c74object.name: mx-autogroup
c74object.description: mx-autogroup groups a (pat) pattern into groups separated by the symbol g. It automatically detects what groupings are possible and has an outlet to fill a umenu with them. Grouping is used to structure a pattern into bigger rhythmical cells with the same length. This object works best in conjunction with the other mx-objects, but user-created (pat) messages may also work.

method.name: groupby
method.digest: Perform grouping by the argument of this message
method.description: Grouping means structuring a pattern into groups of equal length. The object calculates which groupings are possible by modulo division with the sum of the parts of the pattern. This works best with preexisting mx-objects, because they generally put out patterns that are symmetrical and easily groupable, because of their periodic nature. Example: 2 2 1 1 2 2 groupby 2 -> g 2 g 2 g 1 1 g 2 g 2. 2 2 1 1 2 2 groupby 5 -> g 2 2 1 g 1 2 2.
